page.title: 05COURT IN CULLOMPTON
page.content: The Magistrates Court,built in 1966_67 sits on Monday mornings and serves surrounding areas as well. In the court room three magistrates sit at a raised bench,the chairperson in the middle.The defendant sits on the left,the prosecutor on the right.There is room for lawyers,police and witnesses.People take an oath before giving evidence. There are two cells to keep prisoners in just before their case comes up if the defendants are in custody.Serious cases are heard at{ {Exeter Crown Court.}Maximum fine here is Â£2 000,juvenile court Â£400. The court used to sit in the old police station,upstairs.On court days the line of people waiting could stretch down the stairs out in the street.
